snippet: Robert Bergdahl fought in Washington for his son’s release from the Taliban for five years. On Saturday, President Obama said Bowe Bergdahl was coming home.
abstract: Freeing of American prisoner of war Sgt Bowe Bergdahl in Afghanistan marks end of his father Robert Bergdahl's five-year effort to secure his son's return; Robert Bergdahl had accused Obama administration of stalling talks for release of his son, and even made his own contact with Taliban to try to find out more about his son's whereabouts.

byline.original: By ELISABETH BUMILLER, MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ANDREW W. LEHREN
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper contributed reporting from Singapore.

lead_paragraph: Robert Bergdahl fought in Washington for his son’s release from the Taliban for five years. On Saturday, President Obama said Bowe Bergdahl was coming home.

headline.main: Lesson for P.O.W.’s Father: Men Sometimes Do Come Back
headline.print_headline: Lesson for a Prisoner’s Father: Men Sometimes Do Come Back
